content.description: Sit start, and follow the features up and slight right to reach a featured topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The climb shares a landing with a rock, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Moby Dick.

content.description: Sit start with your hands matched on mini-shelf. From there, traverse right and head up on edges to reach a featured finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Moby Dick.

content.description: Per Matt Lisenby, Popeye's Demise starts from atop a boulder (possibly with a cheater stack).
content.location: It climbs the west face of Moby Dick.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the mini-shelf. From there, make a big pull up to a right hand edge (crux), match a left next to it, then gain the right hand sidepull, get the feet up to the start hold, and finish straight up the face on the remaining edges to reach an easy topout.
content.protection: A pad or two should do it, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the far northern section of Moby Dick's east face.

content.description: Per Matt Lisenby, Man Overboard has an optional low start with a long move/dyno to the ordinary starting holds.
content.location: This ascends the west face of Moby Dick.

content.description: Sit start with your hands matched on the mini-shelf. From there, climb up using edges and the thin vertical crack to reach the topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Moby Dick.

content.description:
Harpoon ascends a perfect, vertical sandstone face via microedges.

Stand start with an incut, hortizontal left hand edge, and a triangular, right hand pinch-sidepull. From there, work the feet up on edges, gain a thin horizontal edge, paste a high foot, then hit the sloping lip (crux), and top it out.

Understanding the horizontal rail before the lip is crucial. It is small, but some parts of it are ever-so-slightly better than others.
content.protection: A pair of pads will do, the immediate landing is perfect, there are however some rocks behind the problem.
content.location: It ascends the west face of Moby Dick.

content.description: Climb the vertical feature to reach a solid finish.
content.protection: A pad or two will be fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Moby Dick.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of edges. From there, climb up on edges to reach an airy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads and a spot wouldn't hurt. The landing is good, just don't come off too far to the left.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Moby Dick.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand incut edge and a right hand pinch. From there, climb up and left for the topout.
content.protection: A pad will work. There are a few rocks behind the fall zone though.
content.location:
It climbs the east face face of Moby Dick. Use the same start as

Harpoon

.
